caption: Gorgeous view, came on a Monday between 2pm-3pm just the 3 of us. Got a few shops in the middle of the tower that do pizzas, chips, refreshments. We wanted a slush whilst it was 37Â° and obviously its a sell out on a day like that, so wasn't able to grab one. No bother, there was still plenty of refreshments to grab.  Nice views of Paris, was definitely worth the experience! I'd recommend extra staff for the Cafe areas as we were lined up for 30 minutes with 2 people serving, but they were polite and friendly and overall the experience is something we all very much enjoyed and recommend ðŸ˜Š

The best and beautiful Eiffel Tower ever! In night it's look so lovely! In winter it's so good when start the snow fall.thanks France for this lovely architecture! Personal it's lovely and if you want to hike you need to pay extra. Thanks everyone

I visited the Eiffel Tower gardens today and was thoroughly impressed. The meticulously maintained lawns, vibrant flowerbeds, and charming pathways create a serene atmosphere, perfect for a leisurely stroll. The gardens offer stunning views of the Eiffel Tower, providing ample photo opportunities. Benches scattered throughout allow for moments of rest and reflection, making it an ideal spot to unwind. The combination of lush greenery and the iconic backdrop of the Eiffel Tower makes these gardens a must-visit for anyone in Paris.
Great place the visit, but over crowded even I'm the evenings, people pushing you around trying to get infront of you. Prices of drinks and food not bad cheaper than expected

People will moan about about the crowds but its paris!  Once you get past that you will be gobsmacked by the sheer beauty that is the eiffel tower and the lovely ponds and gardens .  We went at night which i would recommend as during the day the tower can look a bit glum . But at night is just impressive by anyone's standards and if you're lucky to be there when the light show is on you will love it.  Quite the wait for the 2 x lifts to reach the top but worth the wait if you only do it once in your life.

We booked in advance and thank goodness, minimal queue, straight to lift and up to the 2nd floor.  Apart from personally being terrified due to heights not being my favourite the kids and my wife loved it.  A must!

every season has a different perception of this tower, that's why I always come to see the Eiffel Tower when I'm in Paris. I really understand the Parisians when they were against this Tower , it really violates the architecture of the city a little, but there is no more famous place in the world) entrance to the tower is 25 euros by the way and you can wait from 40 minutes to 4 hours, so choose your time wisely, the best on weekday mornings.

Lots of tourist hanging around this area. It is not uncommon to find someone who proposes here. We've seen it when we visited. The garden can be a bit dirty but the view of the Eiffel makes up for it. Beware of scammers and hustlers asking you to sign a petition.

A huge green, leafy area surround's the most magnificent tower, as you would expect its is packed with visitors in the immediate vicinity of the tower, however the expanse of the gardens, spreads the numbers out.
I was lucky enough to be able to watch the Olympic medal matches for the womenâ€™s beach volleyball in the Eiffel garden stadium. It created a unique experience I will never forget.

A visit to the **Eiffel Tower** is a journey to the heart of Parisian elegance and a symbol of French ingenuity. Standing tall at 324 meters, it offers breathtaking views of the City of Lights and has been a beacon of inspiration for over a century. With its **4.6 rating** on Google from over **240,000 reviews**, it's a beloved landmark that captures the essence of Paris.  Here's a caption for your Eiffel Tower experience: "Under the Parisian sky, the Eiffel Tower whispers stories of old, a timeless sentinel over a city of dreams. #EiffelTower #ParisAdventures #CityOfLights"  May your time at the Eiffel Tower be as magnificent as the structure itself! ðŸ—¼âœ¨
Donâ€™t miss the evening shimmers, they happen every hour for 5 minutes. Itâ€™s a really great experience, the tower is really big and pretty!

Best experience ever! I went to the top of the Tower after visiting several places and was able to recognize the museums, Churches, main touristic places. It was a beautiful farewell! See you soon Paris!

Recorded and took these pictures and videos on different occasions, couldn't upload them until now.  Amazing structure, really impressive to see it live. You see monuments on tv or pictures and you see how Beautiful they might be, but seeing them in person is another thing. I just can't stop watching it, Every time I come to Paris, I need to stop around and take a picture.

Very enchanting view of the Eiffel Tower from this garden. We have seen the gorgeous and stunning beauty of the Eiffel Tower from multiple locations and angles. The river cruise trip is also great. The night view of the city from the top of the tower is really mesmerizing. Visited this place twice.

Good place to get some photos of the Eiffel Tower. However there are better places as the trees do obstruct the view a little bit. Considering (according to what I've seen) most people approach the tower from the gardens, I think it's a good first glance at the tower before going up or heading to the Palais de Chaillot, right across the Seine. Personally I found it breathtaking when I first saw the Eiffel Tower over the trees.
Day time view is good but night view is out of the world

Really nice park, full of trees, benches, grass  and the best view of the Eiffel tower. There are too many people so be careful of your belongings. Take some drinks with you and sit down with the others and enjoy the lighting of the tower (21:00) with an amazing sunset. The only reason I put 4 stats is because of the people that sell water, champagne and other beverages that are everywhere and ruin the moment.
I haven't visited the Eiffel Tower due to my fear of heights, but its iconic structure and breathtaking views are undeniable. It's a must-see for any traveler. *C'est magnifique!*

If youâ€™re on a budget and time constraint, itâ€™s probably one of the best places to view the Eiffel tower, the other one being the Fontaine du Jardin du TrocadÃ©ro. In winter, the grassy portions are cordoned off to let the grass grow, so youâ€™ll only have the gravel paths to walk around in.
The garden used to much nicer. Revisited again but there were tons of constructions going on that there were barely a couple bench to sit on, fences everywhere, and no grass for picnic.

We attended the garden at sunset and we were able to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. The gardens are huge and we went on an extremely busy day (Paris Fashion Week launch) but yet there was plenty of space to walk around and have a picnic. Itâ€™s as picturesque as they make it appear. Highly recommend visiting â€¦ but how can you not when in Paris!

Full of green grass garden at Eiffel tower where you can sit and relax with the view of Eiffel!! There are neat ponds with full of fishes and goose. There are street shops too. Excellent place to spend your time. Eiffel lighting at night is another good thing to enjoy here.
Here you can enjoy free picnic with a beautiful view of Eifel tower.

Don't bother coming here until the 2024 Olympics are over. Almost all of the garden is fenced up and inaccessible due to construction of sports facilities. Only consolation is that you can still take pics at the front of the Eiffel Tower.

We attended the garden at sunset and we were able to see the Eiffel Tower lit up at night. The gardens are huge and we went on an extremely busy day (Paris Fashion Week launch) but yet there was plenty of space to walk around and have a picnic. Itâ€™s as picturesque as they make it appear. Highly recommend visiting â€¦ but how can you not when in Paris!

Unfortunately, most of the Tour Eiffel Garden was fenced up and there are barely spaces to sit. After the 2024 Olympics, it should be better. But before then, donâ€™t expect to be able to sit and picnic like you see on the famous photos on Instagram!

It's a beautiful view from the garden. But since they are under construction or remodeling, there are many spots covered and are disturbing the view or the full view of the tower. Also Many of the sidewalks are unpaved and I went on rainy day, that makes some sidewalks very muddy.  For this great attraction, I think it's very important to keep garden and sidewalks free of mud.  I saw many boots and pants sprinkle of mud.
Nice look, you can sit on the grass and enjoy the view.
love the place the only thing is that now their is a lot a barricades, that wasnâ€™t there years ago, but still a very nice place to go
A very beautiful garden to enjoy the magnificent view of the Tour Eiffel, ideal for a typical picnic.
Lovely spot to relax and enjoy the view of the Eiffel Tower.  Very clean and well maintained. Spacious so does not get overcrowded.
garden under big metallic piece ! the ducks are paid actors, love it :3

I had such a memorable time taking a sunset stroll through the Jardin de la Tour Eiffel. This hidden gem in the bustling streets of Paris offers a peaceful escape with its lush green grass, vibrant flowers, and towering trees. It's the perfect place for a picnic or a leisurely walk, and the Eiffel Tower in the distance adds a picture-perfect backdrop.  As the sun started to set, the garden transformed into a magical place. The beauty of the surroundings was simply undeniable, and it was a much-needed break from the busy city life. The view of the Eiffel Tower against the evening sky was absolutely breathtaking and added to the garden's charm.  But I must admit, the persistent street sellers slightly dampened the experience. Their constant display of souvenirs and trinkets, at times, felt intrusive and disrupted the peaceful atmosphere of the garden.  Nevertheless, there was still an undeniable sense of tranquility in the air. Maybe it was the natural beauty of the garden or the enchanting allure of Paris itself, but it truly provided a moment of serenity amidst the city's hustle and bustle.  I highly recommend the Jardin de la Tour Eiffel for anyone looking to experience a different side of Paris. It's a perfect spot for those seeking peace, natural beauty, and a break from the city's chaos.
Amazing to view at night and wait for the hour to pass cause it sparkles

It was a giant telecom tower or a project that lost funding before the finish. This is where the great German leader must have gotten the idea of "just lie until it becomes true". It's unique... yeah. Half-done software is unique.
Just go at the top. Photos cannot capture the view. You will understand whyâ€¦.Make a reservation and get the ticket with the champaign glass included.

The gardens surrounding the Eiffel Tower, known as the **Champs de Mars**, offer a peaceful and scenic escape from the bustling crowds that visit the monument. Here's a quick guide to what you can expect from the Eiffel Tower gardens:  ### **1. Beautiful Green Space:** The Champs de Mars is a large public park that stretches from the base of the Eiffel Tower to the Ã‰cole Militaire. Itâ€™s one of the most famous green spaces in Paris, offering stunning views of the tower framed by lush trees and carefully manicured lawns. Itâ€™s a perfect spot for relaxing, strolling, or having a picnic.  ### **2. Perfect for Picnics and Relaxation:** Many tourists and locals alike choose to bring food and drinks to enjoy a leisurely picnic with the Eiffel Tower as a backdrop. Whether youâ€™re there during the day or the evening, the serene environment makes for a great place to unwind and take in the sights. Sunset is particularly magical, with the tower gradually lighting up as the sky changes colors.  ### **3. Peaceful Walkways and Sculptures:** There are several paths lined with trees and beautiful flowerbeds throughout the park, ideal for a relaxing walk. As you explore, youâ€™ll also find statues and fountains, adding to the parkâ€™s charm. The lush greenery contrasts beautifully with the iron structure of the Eiffel Tower, creating a picturesque setting for photos.  ### **4. Playgrounds and Activities:** If you're traveling with children, there are several playgrounds in the gardens, as well as open spaces where families can play or relax. Throughout the year, you might also find pop-up attractions, like seasonal markets or art exhibitions, adding a bit of variety to your visit.  ### **5. Great Photo Opportunities:** The gardens offer some of the best angles for capturing the Eiffel Tower in photos, especially from the far end of the park. The long, sweeping lawns and fountains create a perfect leading line toward the tower, making it an ideal spot for photography.  ### **6. Evening Ambiance:** At night, the ambiance of the gardens changes entirely. As the tower sparkles every hour on the hour, the Champs de Mars becomes a romantic spot for evening strolls. The quiet hum of the city in the background and the glow of the tower provide a tranquil and memorable experience.  ---  **Conclusion:** The gardens around the Eiffel Tower provide a serene and beautiful setting for visitors to enjoy, whether youâ€™re looking to relax, explore, or snap that perfect photo. They offer a peaceful contrast to the busy nature of the tower itself, making them a must-visit for anyone spending time in the area.  .:.Chat.G.P.T.:.
